decks.notes: The deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and maintain an advantage over the opponent. It combines powerful, evasive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to keep the opponent on the back foot. Teferi, Time Raveler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional disruption and card advantage, while Consign to Memory and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd offer flexibility and utility in various situations. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for a fast and proactive game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells and combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It leverages cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to create early pressure and control the board. By using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm, the deck can deal direct damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah adds another layer of threat to the deck. Overall, the strategy is to be fast, proactive, and relentless in attacking the opponent.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death and Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with efficient and aggressive creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Solitude to control the board, while also employing creatures like Guide of Souls and Witch Enchanter to apply pressure. The deck also includes cards like Flagstones of Trokair to fix mana and generate value, as well as various utility spells like Prismatic Ending and Thraben Charm. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategies while quickly closing out the game with powerful creatures.

This modern Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts, using them to generate mana and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of threats and disruption cards, while maintaining a high level of card advantage through efficient draw and recursion. The key is to capitalize on the synergy between artifacts and creatures, utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal to accelerate the deployment of threats and control elements. By combining aggressive plays with disruptive elements, this deck aims to dominate the board and dictate the pace of the game.

This deck revolves around assembling the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan combo to generate massive amounts of mana and search for powerful lands like Urza's Saga. Using cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana production and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and land drops. The key strategy is to efficiently search for the combo pieces and quickly get them on the battlefield to set up powerful plays and combos. The deck also includes utility lands and spells to support the combo and provide additional options for control and aggression.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy with counterspells, removal spells, and discard spells while gradually building card advantage and maintaining board control using powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes card draw and library manipulation to ensure consistency in drawing key cards. By playing a reactive game and managing resources effectively, this Dimir Control archetype aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

The deck aims to efficiently generate mana using rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Past in Flames and Ral, Monsoon Mage. The deck also includes cards like Reckless Impulse and Valakut Awakening to dig for combo pieces, while utilizing Wish to access sideboard cards. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and explosive plays with a combo finish using artist's talents and Wrenn's Resolve to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Baubles and elegant parlor adds additional consistency and card draw to the deck.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. Using cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, it can disrupt the opponent's strategy and take control of the game. Devourer of Destiny and Eldrazi Temple provide powerful threats while Thought-Knot Seer and Dismember help with disruption. The deck also includes cards like Abstergo Entertainment and Vexing Bauble for additional utility and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining powerful artifact creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor with efficient artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal, the deck aims to establish a board presence quickly and close out the game before the opponent can respond. With disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Portable Hole to control the opponent's plays, the deck strives to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual to cast powerful and disruptive creatures and spells from both the blue and green color pie. By utilizing cards like Ice-Fang Coatl and Coiling Oracle for card advantage, along with Subtlety for tempo plays, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggression and control. With a solid mana base and access to counterspells like Force of Negation, the deck can adapt to different matchups and disrupt opponent's game plans while maintaining pressure on the board.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure through aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Phelia. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to control the game by bouncing threats and preventing instant-speed interaction. Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory provide versatile removal options. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Quantum Riddler offer card advantage and card selection. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors while maximizing consistency. Overall, the deck seeks to outpace opponents with a mix of disruption, card advantage, and aggressive threats.

The main idea behind this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also focuses on controlling the game with cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful control spells, while also having the flexibility to adapt to different situations with its variety of cards.

The deck primarily focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. This mana is then used to play powerful control cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Emrakul, the Promised End to dominate the game. With strong removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command, along with disruptive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focused on aggressive play with a blend of disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources. It aims to pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phlage while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to disrupt their game plan. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and card advantage, while cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory offer removal options. The deck also includes some card selection and filtering tools to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creature damage and burn spells. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah helps provide a boost to your creatures, while Thraben Charm and Galvanic Discharge can help remove threats from the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, while cards like Arena of Glory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility and flexibility in gameplay.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also being able to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Lightning Bolt to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth give the deck additional ways to push through damage and close out games. This deck aims to be fast and powerful, applying pressure from the very beginning of the game.
